meta_description: Iroquois Museum is an educational institution dedicated to fostering understanding of Iroquois culture using Iroquois art as a window to that culture. iroquoismuseum.org
hours_text:
## Visit the Iroquois Museum

​ADMISSION RATES

Regular Admission:

Adults: $8

Seniors (62+): $6.50

Students (13 - 17): $6.50

Children (5 -12): $5 

Children Under Five: Free

​

Group Admission:

Requires 10 or more paying individuals.

Adults: $7.00 

Seniors (62+): $5.50

Students: (13-17): $5.50 

Children (5-12): $4.00

​

​Guided Tours:

Requires 10 or more paying individuals. Please call ahead to schedule a tour. We cannot accommodate walk-ins for guided tours. 

​

Our guided tours are led by Haudenosaunee educators. Participants will be introduced to foundational Iroquois history, philosophies, and creative expression. Women's roles and responsibilities, traditional lesson stories, the clan system, formation of the Iroquois Confederacy, early hunting methods, and Iroquois participation in the US military may be part of your presentation. And of course, a lively Q & A is always included! Programs can be personalized to fit your interests, time frame, and physical mobility.

​

Adults: $10.00 

Seniors (62+): $8.50 

Students (13-17): $8.50 

Children (5-12): $7.00

​

​​School Programs:

Looking to organize an event for your students? Check out our [In-house programs ](https://www.iroquoismuseum.org/schoolprograms)or [Video Visits](https://www.iroquoismuseum.org/video-visits). 

HOURS

May 1st through October 31st

Sunday: 12pm - 5pm

Monday: Closed

Tuesday: 10am - 5pm

Wednesday: 10am - 5pm

Thursday:10am - 5pm

Friday: 10am - 5pm

Saturday:10am - 5pm

April & No...

collections_text:
[OPEN FOR 2026 SEASON ON APRIL 2](https://www.iroquoismuseum.org/workshops-events)

[We acknowledge that the Iroquois Museum is located on the ancestral lands of the Kanienʼkehá꞉ka (Mohawk people). We honor all Haudenosaunee through our educational exhibitions, events and activities. We value their connection to this valley and offer our respect to all Haudenosaunee people of the past and present.](https://www.iroquoismuseum.org)

[](https://museums4all.org)
